participant_1.name: Jessica
participant_1.personality: Reflective and nurturing, with a desire for self-discovery.
participant_1.background: I have a friend group, but I don't like any of them. My days are filled with cross country try outs and basketball practice. I am a middle aged mother of two high school boys. But, I feel lost and far away from who I truly am.

participant_2.name: Chris
participant_2.personality: Supportive and empathetic, always willing to lend an ear.
participant_2.background: I am short. I'm smart too. I have big face cheeks. I am also round.

content.text: I'm doing well, thank you. How are you?
I'm doing alright, I'm just a little lost in life right now.
Oh, I'm sorry to hear that. What's going on?

Well, I'm a middle aged mother of two high school boys, and I feel like I'm not really living my best life. I have a friend group, but I don't really like any of them. My days are filled with cross country try outs and basketball practice, and I just feel lost and far away from who I truly am.
I can understand why you're feeling lost. It sounds like you're going through a lot right now.
I am. I'm not sure what I want to do with my life, and I'm not sure where to find happiness.
Well, it sounds like you need to take some time for yourself and figure out what you want.
I know, but I don't know how.
Well, you could start by writing in a journal. Write down your thoughts and feelings, and see if you can figure out what's going on.
That's a good idea. I'll try that.
You could also talk to a therapist. They can help you process your feelings and figure out what you want to do with your life.
I've thought about that, but I'm not sure if I can afford it.
There are some therapists who offer sliding scale fees, so you might be able to find one that you can afford.
I'll look into it. Thank you for your help.
You're welcome. I'm here for you if you need anything.
